issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The product is working as designed.
resolution.name: Not a Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I tried creating a windows server 2012 R2 image. I ran the euca-import-instance command which seemed to run successfully however the euca-describe-conversion-tasks reported the task cancelled/ failed state:

[root@cdc-clc-01 eucalyptus]# euca-describe-conversion-tasks import-vol-dfbcfba2
TaskType        IMPORTVOLUME    TaskId  import-vol-dfbcfba2     ExpirationTime  Thu Jul 02 09:57:38 PDT 2015    Status  cancelled       StatusMessage   Image conversion failed
DISKIMAGE       DiskImageFormat RAW     DiskImageSize   17825792000     VolumeId        vol-04e3356c    VolumeSize      17      AvailabilityZone        cdc-west-1      ApproximateBytesConverted       8556380160


The cloud-error.log states it can not DeleteVolumeType to service  EucalyptusRequestQueueSync because: Component that caused exception is: DefaultJavaComponent{Volume.component}. Message payload is of type: DeleteVolumeType

The entire message is the following:
Thu Jun 25 11:01:06 2015 ERROR [EucalyptusActivityTasks$EucalyptusActivityTask:AbstractListenableFuture: java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker@6a7a10c2[State = -1, empty queue]] [com.eucalyptus.imag
ing.common.EucalyptusActivityTasks$EucalyptusActivityTask.dispatchFailure(EucalyptusActivityTasks.java):3263] Eucalyptus activity error
com.eucalyptus.context.ServiceDispatchException: Failed to send message DeleteVolumeType to service EucalyptusRequestQueueSync because: Component that caused exception is: DefaultJavaComponent{Volume.compone
nt}. Message payload is of type: DeleteVolumeType
        at com.eucalyptus.context.ServiceContext.send(ServiceContext.java:220)
        at com.eucalyptus.context.ServiceContext.send(ServiceContext.java:199)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.async.AsyncRequests$1.call(AsyncRequests.java:92)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.async.AsyncRequests$1.call(AsyncRequests.java:89)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)

        at com.eucalyptus.system.Threads$Queue.run(Threads.java:752)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: com.eucalyptus.context.ServiceDispatchException: Component that caused exception is: DefaultJavaComponent{Volume.component}. Message payload is of type: DeleteVolumeType

fields.summary: Conversion Task fails for creating EBS windows image

comments.body: [~Christopher], Could you provide output from euca-describe-properties | grep maxvolumesizeingb ? I suspect that you are trying to import 17G image into cloud with 15G (this is default in Eucalyptus) limit for a volume.

That was my first error in which I decided to grow it to 30. I actually got a different error message that led me to believe I needed to change that property value before encountering this new issue. Nonetheless, here is what you were asking for:

[root@cdc-clc-01 ~]# euca-describe-properties | grep -i maxvolumesizeingb
PROPERTY        cdc-west-1.storage.maxvolumesizeingb    30
PROPERTY        cdc-west-2.storage.maxvolumesizeingb    30

Thanks
Christopher Curts
[~Christopher], do you still have issues with import-instance after changing the limit?

After I changed it a second time to be 50gb it finally worked. I am assuming the volume size has to be at least twice the size of the image itself before Eucalyptus is able to process it. So, when I changed the property to 30, it got passed the initial error but then failed when trying to delete (I am assuming clean up) the volume. This is a second time that a property value bit me and my team when setting up our cloud. Did I miss a glossary section in the documentation that states all the property variables and explains what they do?

The documentation for creating and registering new images should also probably be updated to state that if you are trying to register a windows image using the euca-register command then you should add the flag --platform windows. Since I was following along in the instructions, I accidentally created a windows image which the cloud interpreted as a linux platform.

I appreciate your assistance Vasiliy!

[~Christopher], The EUCA-9409 covers the max volume case and should warn users up-front. You should not need double sized volume limit for the import. Please file a new bug if you do see this behavior. Please also file a doc ticket if you see a documentation gap about image registration. I am close this bug for now.
